text:
Hi Violet :)
So when I was graduating my plan was to land an internship or a runner job ( my school was unfortunately more about 3D so I didn't have anything in comp to show except some small roto and paint, so I knew I was going to have to start by an entry level position and not straight to comp ).
So to show my interest in 2D, I did some roto and paint work outside of the assignements from school to help my reel. Then Double Negative team was going to come to our school and a few of us would be selected for interviews, so I worked veryyyy hard and a lot to get my reel ready in time and got an interview with them.
Then they liked my profile, so I had another interview and they took me for the 2D runner position where I did a training in roto and prep.
So my plan was basically just to make it to a very low entry level position inside a big vfx company to have my foot in the door as I didn't have any comp work to show from school :)

That sounds awesome ! Can you show me a screenshot of it so that I can understand the shot better ? It's hard to picture it in my head ^^
For the depth, the best would be to have a Z depth pass but I'm not sure it's possible in After Effects. Then I would play with the color correct ( offset, gain, gamma...) to fake some depth in Nuke.
Out of the box like this I'd say that LumaKey would work but again without seeing the shot is quite hard to advice :slightly_smiling_face:
